ticket.title: Normalize all declassification receipt consumption as PCAC-gated effects (sweep remaining ad-hoc consume paths; enforce request-scoped binding + non-colliding indexes)

tickets.reason: Kernel should own receipt consumption to avoid bypass.
Receipt events must bind to AdmissionBundleDigest for O(1) correlation.

in_scope: Audit and eliminate any remaining non-PCAC 'single-use receipt' tracking (in-memory maps, ledger scans, best-effort flags).
Ensure declassification receipt consumption uses PCAC lifecycle with durable consume + intent equality.
Ensure consumption ledger events carry replay-critical binding fields (receipt_id/hash, request_id, tool_class, channel_key, argument/content digest, intent_digest).
Ensure consumption ledger events include AdmissionBundleDigest for O(1) correlation and postmortems.
Ensure uniqueness constraints for receipt events do not collide across event types (scope uniqueness by event_type or dedicated index).

steps: Search for consumed_* tracking and migrate to PCAC-gated consumption.
Add restart test: consume once, restart daemon, second attempt denies.
Add cross-request replay test: consume for request A, attempt for request B denies.

criteria: No ad-hoc receipt single-consume tracking remains for declassification paths.
Replay across request and across restart is denied by construction and tested.
Receipt event uniqueness collisions are structurally impossible.

notes.security: This closes a persistent exploit class: receipt replay and crash-reset of in-memory consume state.
